availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Paris Frost (Union County, Tennessee, farmer and postmaster)

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer and postmaster. Tennessee native. Son of Stephen Frost and Nancy Frost. Married to Amanda Frost. Father of Simeon Frost, William Frost, Joshua Frost, Joseph Frost, and Samuel Frost. Farmer in Grainger County, Tennessee, in 1850. Appointed postmaster in Cedar Ford, in Union County, Tennessee, on August 25, 1857. Farmer in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Grainger County, District 14, p. 121A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 4, p. 443.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, vol. 14, p. 524 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
